summary: This is an internal email sent on August 13, 2019, from an unspecified sender to an unspecified recipient(s), likely within the FBI ('the Bureau'). It is a message of support and encouragement to staff, acknowledging the pressures of their work and urging them to support each other and a specific colleague (whose name is not provided).

events.title: Internal FBI Support Message
events.description: An internal email is sent within the FBI, acknowledging the pressures on staff, defending the Bureau against external criticism, and urging mutual support and outreach to a specific colleague.

keyFacts: The document is an internal FBI email dated August 13, 2019, sent in the evening.
The message defends the FBI's work against external criticism and acknowledges the high-pressure nature of the staff's duties.
It explicitly instructs recipients to reach out to and support a specific colleague, referred to only as 'him', indicating he remains part of the team.
The context suggests this communication was sent during a period of significant stress or scrutiny for the FBI, possibly related to high-profile investigations.
No specific individuals are named in the provided text; all references to people are general ('each of you', 'our staff', 'him').
